channel.title: What does one TRILLION dollars look like?
channel.description:
[size=18pt][b]What does one TRILLION dollars look like?[/b][/size]
All this talk about "stimulus packages" and "bailouts"... A billion dollars... A hundred billion dollars... Eight hundred billion dollars... One TRILLION dollars...
We'll start with a $100 dollar bill. Currently the largest U.S. denomination in general circulation. Most everyone has seen them, slighty fewer have owned them. Guaranteed to make friends wherever they go.
[img]http://1337pix.com/uploads/a0117590da.jpg[/img]
A packet of one hundred $100 bills is less than 1/2" thick and contains $10,000. Fits in your pocket easily and is more than enough for week or two of shamefully decadent fun.
[img]http://1337pix.com/uploads/7bbf845cc7.jpg[/img]
Believe it or not, this next little pile is $1 million dollars (100 packets of $10,000). You could stuff that into a grocery bag and walk around with it.
[img]http://1337pix.com/uploads/9e3b91bd55.jpg[/img]
While a measly $1 million looked a little unimpressive, $100 million is a little more respectable. It fits neatly on a standard pallet...
[img]http://1337pix.com/uploads/ec95c7a9ae.jpg[/img]
And $1 BILLION dollars... now we're really getting somewhere...
[img]http://1337pix.com/uploads/b2159b4939.jpg[/img]
Next we'll look at ONE TRILLION dollars. This is that number we've been hearing so much about. What is a trillion dollars? Well, it's a million million. It's a thousand billion. It's a one followed by 12 zeros.
You ready for this? It's pretty surprising.
[img]http://1337pix.com/uploads/b77d4841ca.jpg[/img]
(And notice those pallets are double stacked.)
So the next time you hear someone toss around the phrase "trillion dollars"... that's what they're talking about. ;)

item.title: What does one TRILLION dollars look like?
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Kane., post:7, topic:267799”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=353541.msg2709219#msg2709219 date=1237188389]
if you put them end to end is it enough to go around the circumference of the earth?
[/quote]

Well, using Wiki…

“size-small-notes”; 6.14" lengthways.
6.14" * 1T = 6140000000000.
6 140 000 000 000 inches = 155 956 000 kilometers

Earth — Circumference: 40, 075.02 KM

;)[/quote]
what bout to the moon and back?

Read full topic
item.source: What does one TRILLION dollars look like?

but when they borrow it, with a rate of 1 euro = 1 dollar, and when they pay back the money 1 euro = .50 dollar (extreme differences) then the debt is only worth 500k dollars (That is with a debt of 1 million euros btw)
